ardiac sarcoidosis.

Clinical details — c/o Non ischemic CMP, ?Post myocarditi

reveal dilated left ventricular cavity. Medium sized, moderate to
severely hypoperfused area noted in mid and distal anterior wall and apical region. Also noted
medium sized, moderate to severely hypoperfused area in mid and proximal inferolateral wall and
adjacent lateral wall. Perfusion to the rest of the left ventricular myocardium is within normal limits.

Cardiac PET/CT: Heterogeneously increased abnormal “Ga-DOTANOC uptake noted in the lateral
wall of left ventricular myocardium. Cardiomegaly noted.

Whole body PET/CT findings:

Head_and Neck: Mucosal thickening noted in bilateral maxillary sinuses. Few subcentimetric
cervical level IB and Il lymph nodes noted, with no significant tracer uptake. Normal radiotracer
uptake noted in the pituitary gland. Visualized skull base, pharynx, larynx and rest of neck spaces do

not show any abnormality.
Thorax: AICD pocket noted in situ in left upper anterior chest wall. Few small right paratracheal,

paraaortic, subcarinal and bilateral hilar lymph nodes with no significant tracer uptake noted. Large
airways, lungs, pleura, great vessels and other mediastinal structures appear normal.

Abdomen-Pelvis: Normal radiotracer distribution is noted in the liver, spleen, adrenal glands and
urinary bladder.

Musculo-skeletal System: No area of abnormal radiotracer uptake noted in the muscles and skeleton.

Impression:

¢ Dilated left ventricular cavity.
« Perfusion defects in the mid and distal anterior wall, apical region, mid and proximal

inferolateral wall and adjacent lateral wall - suggestive of post inflammatory fibrosis.
Heterogencously increased “Ga-DOTANOC uptake in the lateral wall of left Ventricular

.
myocardium — suggestive of active inflammatory pathology.
)

FINDINGS:

Liver appears normal in contours, size and parenchymal attenuation. Intrahepatic biliary radicles are
not dilated. Portal vein appears normal. Hepatic veins and IVC are normal. No occult enhancing focus
is noted.

Gall bladder appears partially distended with no obvious CT dense contents. CBD is not dilated.
Spleen is normal in size and normal attenuation. No focal lesion is seen.

Pancreas appears normal in contours and attenuation pattern. Peripancreatic fat planes are relatively
preserved. No focal lesion is apparent.

Right kidney is not seen — post operative status.

Left kidney shows normal attenuation pattern and adequate contrast excretion. CM differentiation is
maintained. No perinephric collection is apparent. Heterogeneously enhancing mass with

lobulated mass is seen in left suprarenal region. It measures ~ 5.3 x 4.2 cm. It is indenting left
kidney in superior surface. 5

5 mm calculus (CT value ~ 800 HU) is seen at mid pole of left kidney.
No lymph nodal enlargement and ascites are seen in abdomen and pelvis.
Urinary bladder is well distended. Mild wall thickening is seen measuring approx 4 mm.
Prostate gland is normal in size with normal contours and attenuation.
Mild dilatation of bilateral seminal vesicles are seen.
Visualized bowel loops appear normal. No definite obvious focal mass lesion is apparent, at present.
Visualized bones appear normal.

Name: Ankit Age: 24yrs Sex: Male
Name of the test: °”” Te-Sestamibi myocardial perfusion study and “Ga-DOTANOC PET/CT
Study no: PET-021-23 UHID. No: 106484784 Study Date: 10-02-2023

ardiac sarcoidosis.

Clinical details — c/o Non ischemic CMP, ?Post myocarditi

reveal dilated left ventricular cavity. Medium sized, moderate to
severely hypoperfused area noted in mid and distal anterior wall and apical region. Also noted
medium sized, moderate to severely hypoperfused area in mid and proximal inferolateral wall and
adjacent lateral wall. Perfusion to the rest of the left ventricular myocardium is within normal limits.

Cardiac PET/CT: Heterogeneously increased abnormal “Ga-DOTANOC uptake noted in the lateral
wall of left ventricular myocardium. Cardiomegaly noted.

Whole body PET/CT findings:

Head_and Neck: Mucosal thickening noted in bilateral maxillary sinuses. Few subcentimetric
cervical level IB and II lymph nodes noted, with no significant tracer uptake. Normal radiotracer
uptake noted in the pituitary gland. Visualized skull base, pharynx, larynx and rest of neck spaces do

not show any abnormality.
Thorax: AICD pocket noted in situ in left upper anterior chest wall. Few small right paratracheal,

paraaortic, subcarinal and bilateral hilar lymph nodes with no significant tracer uptake noted. Large
airways, lungs, pleura, great vessels and other mediastinal structures appear normal.

Abdomen-Pelvis: Normal radiotracer distribution is noted in the liver, spleen, adrenal glands and
urinary bladder.

Musculo-skeletal System: No area of abnormal radiotracer uptake noted in the muscles and skeleton.

Impression:

¢ Dilated left ventricular cavity.
¢ Perfusion defects in the mid and distal anterior wall, apical region, mid and proximal

inferolateral wall and adjacent lateral wall - suggestive of post inflammatory fibrosis.
Heterogencously increased “Ga-DOTANOC uptake in the lateral wall of left Nentriqular

.
myocardium — suggestive of active inflammatory pathology.
)
